intro: Acrosanthes anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved candlebush, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is known for its fragrant foliage. Acrosanthes anceps is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
